casebody.data:
GREENBRIAR SHOPPING CENTER, INC., Plaintiff-Appellee, v. LORNE COMPANY, Inc., Defendant-Third Party Plaintiff-Appellant, v. TEXAS PACIFIC INDEMNITY COMPANY, Third-Party Defendant-Appellee. No. 27792. United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. March 19, 1970. John D. Jones, C. Richard McQueen, Greene, Buckley, DeRieux & Jones, Atlanta, Ga., for appellant. Gregg Loomis, Ben L. Weinberg, Jr., Sidney F. Wheeler, Long, Weinberg & Ansley, Atlanta, Ga., for appellees.

Before WISDOM, COLEMAN, and MORGAN, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM:

The construction of a sewer line caused the collapse of a building. Which of two insurance companies shall bear the loss? *545That is the ultimate issue in this litigation.

We adopt the opinion of the District Court, 310 F.Supp. 303 (N.D., Ga., 1969), and affirm the judgment rendered below.

Affirmed.
